Captain's log, Stardate 43657.0 We have arrived at sector four-eight-seven to begin charting this region of the galaxy. Commander Riker has been spared this sometimes tedious duty by virtue of a long overdue personal leave.
Did he send for you too?
Yes... he was very mysterious about it.
Does anyone have any idea what this is all about?
Something happened at that cybernetics conference. Since he's come back he's spent every off duty minute in that lab.
It is very unlike Data to be secretive.
And cautious. He kept the lab locked.
Now how would you know that?
Oh, you are early. Just a moment please.
You may enter now.
C'mon, Data, what is this...
Yeah, what's going on?
I have invited you here to meet someone.
This is Lal. Lal, say hello to Counselor Deanna Troi...
Hello... Counselor Deanna Troi...
How do you do, Lal.
I am functioning... within normal parameters.
And this is Geordi La Forge and Wesley Crusher.
Purpose for... exterior drapings, Father?
Father?
It is the custom that we wear clothing.
It called you "Father", Data.
Yes, Wesley. Lal is my child.
It has a positronic brain... one very similar to my own... I began to program it at the cybernetics conference...
But nobody's ever been able to do that... at least not since you were programmed Data...
There was a new submicron matrix-transfer technology introduced at the conference which I discovered could be used to lay down complex neural net pathways...
You mean a transfer... from your your brain to Lal's...

Exactly, Wesley. I realized for the very first time it was possible to continue Doctor Soong's work. My initial transfers have produced very encouraging results... so I brought Lal's brain back with me to continue.
Data...
I would like to have been consulted.
I have not observed anyone else on board consult with you about their procreation, Captain.
No, but...
... in your case... it's not quite the same.
The intention is the same.

Lal's creation is entirely dependent on me. I am giving it knowledge and skills that are stored in my brain... its programming reflects mine in the same way a human child's genes reflect its parent's genes...
It's true, Captain, this technology requires another positronic brain that's fully programmed...
And Data's the only person around who has one. That does kind of makes him Lal's dad.
Of course, it is not complete. We have only made two transfers.
Why didn't you give it a more human look, Data?
I decided to allow Lal to choose its own appearance and sex.
Mister Data, at your convenience, I'd like to talk to you in my Ready Room. Counselor...
Captain... Have a cigar.
I believe it is customary.
I would suggest we do whatever we can to discourage this perception of the new android as a "child"...
Counselor, it is not a child. It is an invention, albeit an extraordinary one.

Why should biology or technology determine whether it is a child? I see a man who has created an offspring... a new life out of his own being. That suggests a child to me. If Data wishes to call Lal his child, who are we to argue?
If he must, fine. But I don't understand how he can call a five foot android, with heuristic learning systems and the strength of a ten men a "child".
You've never been a parent.
Data, what you have done has very serious ramifications and I am dismayed that you did not inform anyone of what you were doing.
I am sorry I did not anticipate your objections, Captain. Do you wish me to deactivate Lal?
It is a life, Data. It cannot be activated or de-activated simply. It is a stupendous undertaking. Have you any idea what will happen when Starfleet learns of this?
I have followed all Starfleet regulations to the best of my ability, Captain... I expected they would be pleased...
We'll see. My foremost concern is for the safety of this ship and crew. You are faster, stronger, and far more knowledgeable than any human...
I can assure you Lal's programming includes psychological inhibitor safeguards to prevent any threat to the Enterprise.
And in the event of a malfunction?
A malfunction is of course a possibility, Captain. But Lal's program is equipped like mine -- it will shut down before deleterious behavior can begin.
You've taken on quite a responsibility, Mister Data...

To prepare, I have scanned all the available literature on parenting. There seems to be much confusion on the issue. One traditional doctrine insists "spare the rod and spoil the child", suggesting a punitive approach... another more liberal attitude would allow a child enormous freedom...
Data...
And what the Klingons do to their children...
I'm not talking about parenting. I'm talking about the extraordinary consequences of creating new life.
Does that not describe becoming a parent, sir?
You are seeking to achieve what no one, other than your own creator, has been able to achieve -- to make another sentient, functional android. To make another Data.

That is why I must attempt this, Captain. I have observed that in most species, there is a primal instinct to perpetuate themselves. And while I have not been programmed with instinctive behavior patterns, I do understand that I have been, until now, the last of my kind. If I were damaged or destroyed, I would be lost forever. But if I am successful with the creation of Lal, my continuance is assured. I believe I understand the consequences. And I am prepared to accept the responsibility.
Gender female.
That's right, Lal. Just like me.
Gender male.
Correct.
I am... gender neuter. Inadequate.
That is why you must choose a gender, Lal. And complete your appearance.
What are... criteria?
Access your data bank on sexuality, level two. That will define the parameters.
Whatever you choose will be yours for your lifetime, Lal... It is a decision that will affect how people interrelate with you.
I choose... your sex... and appearance.
No, Lal... that would be confusing. We are taking you to the Holodeck to show you several thousand composites which I have programmed. You may choose from them.
Several thousand... ?
This is a big decision...
Counselor... Lal has narrowed the choices to four... would you like to see?
Yes... yes, of course, Data...
Computer, Lal -- gender sequence finalists... begin...
An Andorian female...
Interesting. You'd be the only one on board the Enterprise, Lal...
That could make socialization more difficult.
A human male...
Very attractive... no problem with socialization here...
The human female.
I like her.
A Klingon male.
A friend for Worf.
They are all very interesting, Lal. Do you have a favorite?
Yes. I have... chosen.
Come in, Counselor. I have completed the assembly of the replicated anatomy. I was able to provide Lal with even more realistic skin and eye color than my own.
Congratulations, Data, it's a girl.
This is home.
Home. Place of residence. Social unit formed by a family living together.
Correct, Lal. We are a family.
A chair... to sit in.
A painting.
Painting. Colors produced on a surface by applying a pigment.
I will teach you how to recognize the artistry of paintings.
Soft.
Yes, very good, Lal. You have correctly processed the sense of touch.
There are many fascinating experiences I wish to share with you.
Painting.
No, Lal, this is a flower.
Inhale.
Smell.
Yes.
Show me more, Father.
Second officer, science log supplemental, copy: Starfleet research, Daystrom Institute, Galor Four annex. Reference: development, android designate Lal.
Training in social skills at the most elementary level has begun. Lal is progressing very slowly but is not deterred by early setbacks.
Motor coordination has improved by twelve-point-four percent... this reflects the adaptation of second level neural transfers...
Reflexes still need to develop. The integration of hand/eye coordination seems to be proceeding at a slower developmental rate.
Visual comprehension is especially difficult for Lal. Translating her vast data banks into recognizable applications may improve with additional transfers.
She is also learning to supplement innate android behavior with human responses.
Most encouraging is her commitment to master the skills necessary to live successfully among humans. Her curiosity is insatiable... although it sometimes creates inappropriate behavior...
And I have been interested to note that as I observe Lal learning about her world... I share in her experience, almost as though I am learning things over again...
The transfer itself is fairly simple.
Each neural pathway in my brain has been duplicated precisely in hers...
One advantage of a brain like yours, Data is that we can replicate it.
